meanings.definition: Sell (something) at a price lower than (someone else)
meanings.sent1: The store decided to undersell their competitors by offering the product at a discounted price.
meanings.sent2: She always tries to undersell her products to attract more customers.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was underselling the true value of the rare coin.
meanings.sent4: His persuasive skills were so strong that he could undersell even the most expensive items.
meanings.sent5: The art of underselling requires a good understanding of market prices.

meanings.definition: Present (something) in a way that makes it seem less important or valuable than it really is.
meanings.sent1: The company's marketing team unintentionally undersold the new product by not highlighting its unique features.
meanings.sent2: Some sellers undersell their services to attract more clients, but it may backfire in the long run.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's joke about the diamond ring was underselling its true worth, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her modesty often undersells her incredible talent in painting.
meanings.sent5: The movie trailer was underselling the thrilling plot twists that awaited the audience.
